metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue - the conversation you can have with Shadowheart at any time when she's a member of your party. You can ask her about herself, or events that you've experienced together during your adventures. Her responses to you may differ slightly depending on her current attitude towards you.

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: Indeed. We're overdue for a talk... and a little honesty, on my part.

173.speaker: Shadowheart
173.text: Indeed. We're overdue for a talk... and a little honesty, on my part.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Well now I'm intrigued. Do continue.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: I can never take for granted how someone might react when they learn I worship Lady Shar - easier to just keep it a secret than take the risk. But you showed you had an open mind.

339.speaker: Shadowheart
339.text: More than that, I even have an idol of the Nightsinger to call my own, thanks to you.

178.speaker: Shadowheart
178.text: I could have died in that pod, back on the nautiloid. You could have died, spending precious moments trying to free me, but you did it anyway. I owe you my life.

350.speaker: Shadowheart
350.text: Twice over, in fact. You supported me against Lae'zel. I may not have survived that night without you.

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: I already opened up to you before - shared some of the crumbs of memory that I can still lay claim to.

338.speaker: Shadowheart
338.text: Even things that some might find silly - my favourite flower, my fear of swimming... yet you accepted me, all the same.

219.speaker: Shadowheart
219.text: My wound, my... episodes. You were compassionate, where others might be wary, or worse. You stood by me.

239.speaker: Shadowheart
239.text: It's... it's difficult to put into words, but I think I have the measure of you now. You've gone from stranger, to someone I'd be loath to journey without.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: I'm trying to say that you've earned my trust in a way very few ever have... I want that to mean something. I want you to know more about me - at least, from what I can remember.

201.speaker: Shadowheart
201.text: As long as I've prayed to Lady Shar, I've wished to serve her as a Dark Justiciar.

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: There is scarcely a greater way to fully dedicate yourself to Lady Shar - save perhaps if you become the head of her church.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: Not my mother-mother, I should add. The Mother Superior. Head of Lady Shar's enclave in Baldur's Gate.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: Sometimes I wonder if she would ever deem me ready. I owe her everything, and I only wish to serve, yet she can prove... inscrutable.

233.speaker: Player
233.text: Do you think she'll ever relent, and make you a Dark Justiciar?

336.speaker: Shadowheart
336.text: I don't know. Perhaps if I succeed in my mission, and reach Baldur's Gate. Hope has little place amongst Lady Shar's children - it is an illusion, a distraction. But for this... I hope my time will yet come.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I don't understand - why be so secret about such an ambition?
12.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Early-game/loyal to shar (before decision point)

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: Dark Justiciars are hated by many - judged to be ruthless fanatics. Even the few who would accept a follower of Lady Shar would likely baulk at a Justiciar in their midst.

248.speaker: Shadowheart
248.text: But there's a simpler answer to your question - I simply forgot about the desire I had, until I saw some things that reminded me. Now I can't get it out of my mind.

90.speaker: Player
90.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Early-game/loyal to shar (before decision point)

240.speaker: Shadowheart
240.text: Thank you. I had a feeling you'd be understanding.
240.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Early-game/loyal to shar (before decision point)

200.speaker: Player
200.text: Well that was a load of nothing. I'm not sure why you bothered telling me that.
200.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Early-game/loyal to shar (before decision point)

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Early-game/loyal to shar (before decision point)

292.speaker: Shadowheart
292.text: Fine, it can keep for a while yet.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Yes. There's one more thing I wanted to share about myself. Something I think you deserve to know.
35.context: NodeContext: Big deal for her. Building up to sharing about her past (or what she thinks she knows of it)

344.speaker: Shadowheart
344.text: Yes. There's one more thing I wanted to share about myself. Something I think you deserve to know.
344.context: NodeContext: Big deal for her. Building up to sharing about her past (or what she thinks she knows of it)

269.speaker: Player
269.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: It's difficult to put into words... I think it might be easier to just show you.
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

154.speaker: Shadowheart
154.text: Use the tadpole - the connection. Come into my mind.
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

241.speaker: Player
241.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: What am I going to see?
261.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

209.speaker: Shadowheart
209.text: How I came to be who I am. How I found my way to Lady Shar's embrace.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Use the parasite to explore her mind.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

250.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

177.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

249.speaker: Shadowheart
249.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

159.speaker: Player
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene dissolves away. We are returned to Shadowheart, in the present.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene dissolves away. We are returned to Shadowheart, in the present.

266.speaker: Narrator
266.text: *Something sparks in your memory, about Selûnite rites of passage - you heard once about how they would send their children out into the wilds, to navigate their way home...*
266.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Speaking of the supposed beginning of her time as a shar worshipper.

356.speaker: Player
356.text: No wonder you're so dedicated to Shar - you feel like you owe your life to her.
356.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Speaking of the supposed beginning of her time as a shar worshipper.

167.speaker: Shadowheart
167.text: Lady Shar. But yes - her, and those who saved me, and taught me her ways. The Mother Superior.
167.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Speaking of the supposed beginning of her time as a shar worshipper.

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: She made me who I am... at least, as best as I can remember. She taught me, trained me, punished me when I failed her - which was often.
61.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Hint at a tough upbringing.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: You must have been important to her.

349.speaker: Shadowheart
349.text: Perhaps I was. She sent me on this mission, after all.

156.speaker: Shadowheart
156.text: Abuse. Nonsense. The Mother Superior made me strong - for the Dark Lady.

319.speaker: Player
319.text: As a child should be raised. Your Mother Superior must possess great wisdom.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: No doubt she feels the same way.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: You looked like you were wearing a Moonstone... isn't that commonly worn by Selûnites?

294.speaker: Shadowheart
294.text: You're reading too much into things - a childhood bauble, that's all.

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: Just because Selûnites claim something, doesn't mean they own it.

355.speaker: Player
355.text: Thank you for sharing that with me. I know it can't have been easy.

328.speaker: Shadowheart
328.text: Normally I'd agree, but with you... it's getting easier by the moment.

310.speaker: Narrator
310.text: *You remember that it is common amongst Selûne's followers to send their children into the woods alone - a rite of passage, to find their way home. Perhaps this one had gone awry.*

236.speaker: Shadowheart
236.text: I don't remember how it started. Only how it ended. I was fleeing.
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: A psionic connection opens between the player and Shadowheart. It grows intense, then darkness swallows all until the screen is black. SH then speaks her line in VO.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: You're voluntarily telling me about yourself? Are you feeling unwell? Is it the tadpole?

202.speaker: Shadowheart
202.text: No... the opposite. I feel like I can share this with you. I've never felt that way before.

139.speaker: Shadowheart
139.text: Honestly? Trust. I can't remember the last time I sought to confide in someone like this - maybe I never have, for all I know. But now it just feels... right.

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: Pain is the gauntlet that all who love Lady Shar must endure. Only her embrace can truly heal me.

89.speaker: Shadowheart
89.text: To try and... salve myself would do nothing but shame me in the Nightsingers' eyes.
89.context: NodeContext: 'You can't take shortcuts in spiritual journeys'

131.speaker: Player
131.text: You should not have to suffer in order to be true to your faith.

138.speaker: Shadowheart
138.text: Perhaps you're right... and perhaps one day I won't have to suffer. But I don't think that day has arrived yet. Lady Shar will ease my pain, when she wishes to.

222.speaker: Shadowheart
222.text: Perhaps you're right... and perhaps one day I won't have to suffer. But I don't think that day has arrived yet. Lady Shar will ease my pain, when she wishes to.

234.text: Everyone has to suffer - it's a fact of life. Until Lady Shar deems it is time. I know you mean well, but this is not something for you to fix.

181.speaker: Shadowheart
181.text: Everyone has to suffer - it's a fact of life. Until Lady Shar deems it is time. I know you mean well, but this is not something for you to fix.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: What if your wound pains you at the wrong moment? It could cost us dearly.

210.speaker: Shadowheart
210.text: Perhaps you're right... but there's little we can do about it just now. Maybe a way will present itself in time, if Lady Shar wills it.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: Perhaps you're right... but there's little we can do about it just now. Maybe a way will present itself in time, if Lady Shar wills it.

43.text: I have to be ready to pay any cost that Lady Shar asks of me. If that troubles you, I'm sorry. But it cannot be changed.

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: I have to be ready to pay any cost that Lady Shar asks of me. If that troubles you, I'm sorry. But it cannot be changed.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: Let me guess... you're wondering why I was in pain before. Best if we just get the subject out of the way now...
56.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/referring to something seen earlier

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: The grove sported some rather interesting murals, I must say...
59.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/referring to something seen earlier

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.context: NodeContext: Greets the player, but cuts off at the end (she's about to be overcome by a flare-up of magic pain)

314.speaker: Shadowheart
314.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: A joyous little affliction that visits me with screaming agony on occasion. I'd be lying if I told you I know what causes it...

175.speaker: Shadowheart
175.text: But don't worry - it can't hurt you. Only me.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Was it as painful as it looked?

345.speaker: Shadowheart
345.text: Worse. But it passes quickly. Usually.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: I know that look - you're wondering why I was in pain before. Let's just clear the air about that now.

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: There's something I've been wanting to share with you, if now's a good time...

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: Wouldn't you be, in my place? If there's even the slightest chance that Shar worshippers remain within our reach, we should try and find them.

278.speaker: Shadowheart
278.text: Wouldn't you be, in my place? If there's even the slightest chance that Shar worshippers remain within our reach, we should try and find them.

141.speaker: Shadowheart
141.text: Even if they're all long gone - and that seems quite likely from what we know - who knows what they might have left behind for us to use?

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: My people are nothing if not resourceful.

322.speaker: Shadowheart
322.text: Of course - we need every advantage we can grasp, and this Dark Justiciar stronghold sounds like an opportunity to me. We should look for it.

218.speaker: Shadowheart
218.text: Perhaps they're still down there somewhere, but if not, who knows what they might've left behind for us to claim?

317.speaker: Shadowheart
317.text: Shar worshippers are nothing if not resourceful, I hear.

347.speaker: Shadowheart
347.text: I was. He mentioned Dark Justiciars, and we've come across other signs of a Sharran presence during our travels. I'm not sure I can dismiss that as a coincidence.

301.speaker: Shadowheart
301.text: I seem to recall fragments of tales about them - their prowess in battle, their unshakeable faith. I thought they were the stuff of legends. Perhaps not.

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: The wound on my hand. It never quite heals, and sometimes it causes terrible pain to rip through me. It's my burden though, from Lady Shar. I can feel her influence, somehow...

327.speaker: Shadowheart
327.text: The wound on my hand. It never quite heals, and sometimes it causes terrible pain to rip through me. It's my burden though, from Lady Shar. I can feel her influence, somehow...

293.speaker: Player
293.text: So you knew more than you were letting on before? I hope you'll be more honest in future.

331.speaker: Shadowheart
331.text: I'll try my best. But secrecy is ingrained in me. Lady Shar considers it greater protection than any shield or armour.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: Why would Shar subject you to such a thing?

190.speaker: Shadowheart
190.text: I cannot say - not with what I can recall. But even then, it would not be for me to question her will. Lady Shar has her reasons.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: What causes it to hurt you?

296.speaker: Shadowheart
296.text: It's difficult to say... sometimes I wonder if it's supposed to be guiding me, punishing me, testing me... but perhaps it's none of those. Perhaps it's completely random.

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: I'd like to hope there's more to it than that - some meaning that Lady Shar will reveal to me, when the time is right. Until then, all I can do is endure.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: How can you manage, living with such a thing?

242.speaker: Shadowheart
242.text: It's less difficult than you might imagine, when you can't remember life without it.

299.speaker: Player
299.text: Is there anything I can do to help with it?

206.speaker: Shadowheart
206.text: I don't think so, but you're sweet to ask. Maybe just be patient the next time you see me wince or cry out - it'll pass quickly enough. It always does.

295.speaker: Shadowheart
295.text: Pain is sacred to followers of Lady Shar. Pain will give way to loss, and then to the peace of her eternal darkness. You can tolerate a great deal of suffering, so long as it has meaning.

65.speaker: Shadowheart
65.text: It's just an old wound that hurts me from time to time. Nothing to be concerned about.
65.context: NodeContext: A little evasive (player doesn't know she's a shar worshippper)

313.speaker: Shadowheart
313.text: It's nothing to do with the tadpoles at least, in case your imagination is in danger of getting away from you.
313.context: NodeContext: She's trying to make a joke of it

223.speaker: Shadowheart
223.text: It's just... something I have to live with.
223.context: NodeContext: She's trying to make a joke of it

137.speaker: Player
137.context: NodeContext: She's trying to make a joke of it

229.speaker: Shadowheart
229.text: Quite a lot, if I'm being honest. But it always passes quickly, so I can manage.
229.context: NodeContext: She's trying to make a joke of it

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Are you sure it's not connected to the tadpoles?

145.speaker: Shadowheart
145.text: Positive. You can trust me on that.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: You felt it what? Fly away from you?

245.speaker: Shadowheart
245.text: Yes - no. I don't know. The artefact seems to have powers, and a will of its own. It protects us - I don't know how or why, but I'm glad.

95.speaker: Shadowheart
95.text: I felt it go from me to you. You need its help, just as it needs us - it's still just a box, after all.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I didn't take it. I just suddenly had it.

312.speaker: Shadowheart
312.text: You wouldn't have been able to take it. The artefact has a will of its own - it'd fight back if it didn't want to be with you.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: I suppose you'll want it back.

80.speaker: Shadowheart
80.text: Might not be possible. It's stubborn that way - prone to lashing out. Keep it for now - we can all help to protect it.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Looks like it belongs to me now.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: The other way around, more like. The artefact goes with whom it wishes, and lashes out at anyone who tries to take it. Keep it for now - we can all help to protect it.

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: But make no mistake - when the time comes, when we're cured - the artefact leaves with me.

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: I know... I don't understand how exactly, but I felt it go to you. It's important - keep it close.

290.speaker: Player
290.text: Wait - you don't want it back?

348.speaker: Shadowheart
348.text: I do... but the artefact has a will of its own, and powers to enforce it. It likely won't let me take it back.

287.speaker: Shadowheart
287.text: The best I can do is stay close, bide my time... eventually I'll need to take it. Then I'll have to see what can be done about that.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: There's more to this. How did you get the artefact to begin with?

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: Don't be - it can't harm you. And as for me? Well... I'm used to it.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: Don't be - it can't harm you. And as for me? Well... I'm used to it.

170.speaker: Shadowheart
170.text: Don't be. It's nothing to do with you.

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: I told you already - it's none of your concern.

288.speaker: Shadowheart
288.text: I told you already - it's none of your concern.

122.speaker: Shadowheart
122.text: There's no story. None that you're entitled to hear, anyway. Just forget you ever saw it.

185.speaker: Shadowheart
185.text: It's not easily understood, in my experience. But I'll try.

186.speaker: Shadowheart
186.text: It's not easily understood, in my experience. But I'll try.

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: It's not easily understood, in my experience. But I'll try.

346.speaker: Shadowheart
346.text: Apologies. I was less than forthcoming when you asked before. You didn't know about my faith - I wasn't sure how you'd react.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: Just an old wound that hurts every now and again. No need to make a fuss.
51.context: NodeContext: A little evasive (player doesn't know she's a shar worshippper)

204.speaker: Shadowheart
204.text: Of course - I couldn't leave such a treasure behind. I'll find it a place of honour in the camp.

187.speaker: Shadowheart
187.text: Of course - I couldn't leave such a treasure behind. I'll find it a place of honour in the camp.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: I suppose I owe you thanks. I hadn't expected a Selûnite to lead me to such a beautiful piece. You're full of surprises.

213.speaker: Shadowheart
213.text: In any case, it was certainly not what I expected to find in the Underdark.

128.speaker: Shadowheart
128.text: I wonder... perhaps this is connected to the Dark Justiciars.

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: This is no coincidence, I'm sure of it. I need to keep an eye out for more signs - learn more about the Justiciars' presence in these lands. It could be important.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Very well, let's see if we find anything in future.

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: Thank you. I should have known you'd be understanding.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: If Dark Justiciars were once a power around here, all signs suggest that time has long-passed.

163.speaker: Shadowheart
163.text: All signs we've encountered so far, perhaps. I'll be keeping my eyes peeled, going forward...

18.speaker: Player
18.text: We have more important things to focus on than chasing Sharran ghosts.

226.speaker: Shadowheart
226.text: Why, thank you. Always nice to have you to tell me what is and isn't worthwhile.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: I'm not here to join you on some sort of Sharran pilgrimage. You're lucky I didn't destroy that idol.

263.speaker: Shadowheart
263.text: Perhaps the pilgrimage has already begun, Selûnite. And keep away from the idol - it's mine.

286.speaker: Shadowheart
286.text: This isn't the first sign we've come across. It can't just be a coincidence - they had a presence in these lands once. I should keep watch for more signs.

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: Perhaps I'm just grasping at straws... but I should keep watch for more signs.

168.speaker: Shadowheart
168.text: I suppose I owe you my thanks - unlikely I'd have found this without you leading the way.

205.speaker: Shadowheart
205.text: That structure we saw from a distance, in the Grymforge. Something about it struck me as noteworthy.
205.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/referring to something seen earlier

149.speaker: Shadowheart
149.text: Perhaps we'll find an easier way to reach it, if we keep pressing forward.
149.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/referring to something seen earlier

215.speaker: Shadowheart
215.text: I... I can't. My memories are being withheld for a reason. Lady Shar will return them to me when the time is right. No sooner.

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.text: I... I can't. My memories are being withheld for a reason. Lady Shar will return them to me when the time is right. No sooner.

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: Besides, mushrooms aren't my favourite. I think it's because of the gills...
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart mimes receving the noblestalk. Camera holds on the player as SH is heard consuming it off-screen. She lets out a small groan.NodeContext: Reluctantly giving in

309.speaker: Player
309.text: They're your memories. You don't have to ask permission to know who you are.
309.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart mimes receving the noblestalk. Camera holds on the player as SH is heard consuming it off-screen. She lets out a small groan.NodeContext: Reluctantly giving in

224.speaker: Shadowheart
224.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart mimes receving the noblestalk. Camera holds on the player as SH is heard consuming it off-screen. She lets out a small groan.NodeContext: Reluctantly giving in

267.speaker: Shadowheart
267.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart mimes receving the noblestalk. Camera holds on the player as SH is heard consuming it off-screen. She lets out a small groan.NodeContext: Reluctantly giving in

165.speaker: Shadowheart
165.text: I remember... something. Not everything. It's new and not new at the same time, all jumbled up.

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: I was younger. Much younger. An initiate at the cloister. I was upset about something... the others were teasing me. Mocking my name. Like I wasn't worthy of it...

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: There was another. A tiefling boy with short horns and purple hair. I think he was my friend. He tried to make me feel better...

259.speaker: Shadowheart
259.text: 'Rennald'. That's the last part of it I remember... that must be his name. Perhaps he's still there, in Baldur's Gate.

171.speaker: Shadowheart
171.text: I think so. I remember... something. Not everything. It's new and not new at the same time, all jumbled up.

81.text: I've given my answer - I'm not eating that thing. Go sell it, or make an omelette with it, for all I care.

316.speaker: Shadowheart
316.text: I've given my answer - I'm not eating that thing. Go sell it, or make an omelette with it, for all I care.

216.speaker: Shadowheart
216.text: What's your game, exactly? A Selûnite bearing gifts sounds like a trick if I ever heard one.
216.context: NodeContext: Suspicious. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

231.speaker: Shadowheart
231.text: What's your game, exactly? A Selûnite bearing gifts sounds like a trick if I ever heard one.
231.context: NodeContext: Suspicious. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: No trick. No ulterior motive. It's just a gift.
84.context: NodeContext: Puzzled but grateful. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: You sound troublingly sincere... but thank you. I'll find this a place of honour at camp.
96.context: NodeContext: Puzzled but grateful. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

351.speaker: Player
351.text: Call it a diplomatic gesture in trying times.
351.context: NodeContext: Puzzled but grateful. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

273.speaker: Shadowheart
273.text: I suppose civility never killed anyone... well that's not true, but thank you. I'll find a place of honour...
273.context: NodeContext: Puzzled but grateful. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I merely wanted to prove I'm the better person.
33.context: NodeContext: Flustered, caught between angry and grateful. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

160.speaker: Shadowheart
160.text: You're no such thing. But I'm still keeping this... thank you.
160.context: NodeContext: Flustered, caught between angry and grateful. A selunite player just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Just accept the gift and kiss me like you hate me.
194.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, a little mock-annoyed, on first sentence. To self, exasperated, on second. A selunite player who is also her lover (incongruously), just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Just accept the gift and kiss me like you hate me.
191.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, a little mock-annoyed, on first sentence. To self, exasperated, on second. A selunite player who is also her lover (incongruously), just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

199.speaker: Shadowheart
199.text: Easily done. How am I ever going to explain this in my prayers...?
199.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, a little mock-annoyed, on first sentence. To self, exasperated, on second. A selunite player who is also her lover (incongruously), just gifted her an idol of shar. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

318.speaker: Shadowheart
318.text: You... you thought of me? Thank you, it's beautiful. I'll find a place of honour for it in camp.
318.context: NodeContext: Surprised/appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: Nobody's ever given me anything before. What do I owe you in return?
121.context: NodeContext: Surprised/appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: It's a gift. I'm not expecting anything in return.
153.context: NodeContext: Surprised/appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

329.speaker: Shadowheart
329.text: Thank you. Lady Shar teaches us to forswear material goods... but I think she'll make an exception for her own image.
329.context: NodeContext: Surprised/appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

123.speaker: Player
123.context: NodeContext: Appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: Well, in that case, thank you. I'll always think of you when I look upon it - after I think of Lady Shar, of course.
41.context: NodeContext: Appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Gold and riches will do nicely. Empty out that purse.
143.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest. Playful/appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

13.speaker: Shadowheart
13.text: But kind patron, I am but a humble cleric - all I have belongs to my goddess.
13.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest. Playful/appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: I'm afraid my gratitude is all I have to offer... and a kiss, of course.
50.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest. Playful/appreciative. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: I'm afraid my gratitude is all I have to offer.

321.speaker: Player
321.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest, playful. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: I suppose we can manage that...
36.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest, playful. Player has given her a shar idol. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

227.speaker: Shadowheart
227.text: Perhaps... but they could just as easily mean nothing. Those ruins seemed to be Sharran in nature - at least from what I could see at that distance.

198.speaker: Shadowheart
198.text: Perhaps... but they could just as easily mean nothing. Those ruins seemed to be Sharran in nature - at least from what I could see at that distance.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: If we're able to find a way to get closer later on, well, I'll be very interested in seeing what's down there.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: I do. Remember the Dark Justiciars I told you about? I can't imagine those ruins are just a coincidence.

232.speaker: Shadowheart
232.text: Speaking plainly, this isn't the first sign I've come across of a Sharran presence since we've been journeying together. I can't ignore them forever.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: I do. If there's more worth sharing, you'll be the first to know. Trust me.

258.speaker: Shadowheart
258.text: It might all be a coincidence... but between those ruins, and the signs I saw of Dark Justiciars before? It might be much more.

176.speaker: Shadowheart
176.text: Not just yet - I wouldn't want to get my hopes up. If we can get any closer, and if there's anything more to that place, well... I think I'll have plenty to say then.

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: Just a guess. I can't quite explain... it might be nothing, or it might be something.

262.speaker: Player
262.text: I don't think I want to get any closer to Sharran ruins, if it's all the same.

275.speaker: Shadowheart
275.text: Perhaps not just any Sharran ruins... remember the Dark Justiciars I spoke of before? Might be a coincidence. Might not.

311.speaker: Shadowheart
311.text: We've encountered other signs of a Sharran presence during our time together. I need to understand what it all means. Indulge me, if you can. Please.

221.speaker: Shadowheart
221.text: Don't be nervous. I'll be there to protect you.

180.speaker: Shadowheart
180.text: Just a useful landmark to get our bearings with. I'm not keen on taking wrong turns in the Underdark.

238.speaker: Shadowheart
238.text: Everything, potentially. There is scarcely a greater way to fully dedicate yourself to Lady Shar - save perhaps if you become the head of her church.
238.context: NodeContext: Daydreaming. Was asked about a personal ambition of hers.

333.speaker: Shadowheart
333.text: Everything, potentially. There is scarcely a greater way to fully dedicate yourself to Lady Shar - save perhaps if you become the head of her church.
333.context: NodeContext: Daydreaming. Was asked about a personal ambition of hers.

315.speaker: Shadowheart
315.text: To become a Dark Justiciar is to become the Nightsinger's sword arm - her implement with which she will cast down the unbelievers and win the final battle to restore her perfect, endless darkness...
315.context: NodeContext: Daydreaming. Was asked about a personal ambition of hers.

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: It's all I ever wanted. I prayed it was my calling.
58.context: NodeContext: Hint of bitterness. Was asked about a personal ambition of hers - thwarted so far by her superior.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: But 'Mother' forbid me from seeking to prove myself worthy of the rank. She said I was not ready.
78.context: NodeContext: Hint of bitterness. Was asked about a personal ambition of hers - thwarted so far by her superior.

257.speaker: Shadowheart
257.text: They just reminded me of something half-forgotten... it seemed to depict Lady Shar's warriors in combat. I hadn't known they were active in these parts.

197.speaker: Shadowheart
197.text: They just reminded me of something half-forgotten... it seemed to depict Lady Shar's warriors in combat. I hadn't known they were active in these parts.

189.speaker: Shadowheart
189.text: You know me. I'm not usually one to elaborate if I can avoid it.

169.speaker: Shadowheart
169.text: Not formidable enough to win the battle, it seems. But still, worthy of my respect.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: It seems your brethren were enemies of the druids, once.

31.speaker: Shadowheart
31.text: Once being a long time ago - those murals were hardly recent. I think we all have more current troubles to worry about.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: They looked like Dark Justiciars - an elite force among Lady Shar's ranks. Only the very finest proved themselves worthy of the title.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Sounds like you aspire to join them.

129.speaker: Shadowheart
129.text: What right-minded servant of Lady Shar wouldn't? But it's a distant dream - the Dark Justiciars have been silent for years.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: How did they prove themselves worthy?

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: There was a proving ground of sorts. A place where initiates sought to complete Lady Shar's trials, and make a sacrifice in her name. But that place is lost now. Some even wonder if it ever truly existed.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: Still... to join their ranks would be an honour almost beyond measure. I can but dream...

285.speaker: Shadowheart
285.text: Curious, to see them depicted in such a place. Perhaps there is more to it... but there's nothing to be done about it just now.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: Nobody knows what became of them. Perhaps the battle in the mural wiped them out... but I'm not so sure.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: They can't have been that good - they lost, judging by the murals.

280.speaker: Shadowheart
280.text: The mural is propaganda - who is to say what truly happened. Though it is known that the Dark Justiciars have been silent for years.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Be careful admitting your allegiances to druids - they may still consider you an enemy.

179.speaker: Shadowheart
179.text: Don't worry, it's not information I share too casually. Besides, those murals looked old; the druids have more current troubles to worry about.

144.speaker: Shadowheart
144.text: What can I say? They were eye-catching. Consider me an art-lover.

277.speaker: Shadowheart
277.text: Quite the understatement, but yes - I have it. And I'll guard it with my life.

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: Quite the understatement, but yes - I have it. And I'll guard it with my life.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: Why's it so important to you?

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: Because it's important to my goddess. I was part of a group sent to claim the artefact in her name - and I'm the only survivor.

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: Because it just is. Trust breeds candour, so for now, that's all you need to know.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: And yet you don't know what it is? That doesn't add up.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: Say it costs you your life - what then?

353.speaker: Shadowheart
353.text: Then so be it - I did my duty. As for the artefact... it's powerful. And has a mind of its own sometimes. You'd better hope you're up to bearing it.

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: Don't forget what it was like, when you heard the voice. It'll only get worse if you don't have the artefact to protect you.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: How can you be so sure of yourself? You don't even know what it is you're protecting.

192.speaker: Shadowheart
192.text: It's called faith. Duty. It doesn't have to add up to me so long as I serve. I'm part of a bigger plan - one that will be revealed in time.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: How can you go to all this trouble and not understand why?
117.context: InternalNodeContext: This node for those who know SH is a Shar worshipper but who don't have any Shar tags themselves

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: I told you already - I surrendered my memories, for the sake of the mission.

302.speaker: Shadowheart
302.text: Shar's secrets must be protected - duty demands it. Once I fulfil my mission, I can have my memories restored.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: Because it's safer that way. We had our memories suppressed before the mission - that way, none of us could betray the Dark Lady if we were captured.

320.speaker: Player
320.text: Blind duty? Spoken like a true pawn. They tend to get sacrificed first, you know.
320.context: InternalNodeContext: This node for those who know SH is a Shar worshipper but who don't have any Shar tags themselves

326.speaker: Shadowheart
326.text: How cynical. I should borrow that line sometime. But if I have to die, so be it. Like I said - faith.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Admirable conviction, though I think I'd prefer to know what I was getting myself into.
76.context: InternalNodeContext: This node for those who know SH is a Shar worshipper but who don't have any Shar tags themselves

306.speaker: Shadowheart
306.text: That's not a luxury open to many people, us included. I have my faith to turn to instead. You should find something of your own.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Shar asks a lot of you. What do you get in return?
148.context: InternalNodeContext: This node for those who know SH is a Shar worshipper but who don't have any Shar tags themselves

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: I get to return home. Shar is the only one who's ever offered me a place in this world. If I succeed, I'll be closer to her than ever.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Your devotion to the Dark Lady is truly impressive. I'm sure your rewards will be great.
48.context: InternalNodeContext: This node for those who know SH is a Shar worshipper and who have either the Shar cleric or paladin tag

252.speaker: Shadowheart
252.text: Shar's favour is all the reward I need. She made a place for me where no one else would. If I succeed, I can return to it, and be even closer to her.

67.speaker: Player
67.context: InternalNodeContext: Follow-up branch will be considered done/flagged off after this.

303.speaker: Player
303.text: It's no coincidence that you have that artefact, is it? Remind me how you came by it.
303.context: InternalNodeContext: If background of Sharran mission was mentioned before

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Curious, that you just happen to have an item that can protect us. How did you come by it?
87.context: InternalNodeContext: If background of Sharran mission wasn't mentioned before.

172.speaker: Shadowheart
172.text: I was part of a group sent by my cloister. We were to take the artefact from the githyanki and bring it to Baldur's Gate, no matter the cost.
172.context: NodeContext: Little bit of survivor's guilt.

337.speaker: Shadowheart
337.text: Though it turned out the cost was very steep. I was the only one of the group to survive - I took the artefact and fled... only to be ensnared by mind flayers before I could finish the mission.
337.context: NodeContext: Little bit of survivor's guilt.

116.speaker: Shadowheart
116.text: That's all I know. That's all I need to know.

244.speaker: Shadowheart
244.text: I suppose if we're going to keep helping each other, I might as well tell you... I was part of a group sent to retrieve it, bring it to Baldur's Gate, for our goddess...

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: I worship Shar, the Mistress of the Night. It's my mission to deliver the artefact to her secret cloister in Baldur's Gate.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

324.speaker: Shadowheart
324.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: It's not the sort of thing I can just tell anyone. Let's see if we can build up some trust first.
74.context:
InternalNodeContext: If SH approval of player = less than ten, she won't tell them she's a shar worshipper
Questioning Available flag allows the player to ask SH what she's hiding from them in general (another way to discover her Shar worship)NodeContext: Cagey

268.speaker: Shadowheart
268.text: Like I said before - it's not the sort of thing I can tell just anyone. Maybe with time... or maybe not.
268.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH approval of player = less than ten, she won't tell them she's a shar worshipper (subsequent attempts)NodeContext: Cagey

332.speaker: Player
332.text: You can't protect it by yourself. That's why you're here, with me.
332.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH appeared with the box, seeking a partnership with the player (Shadowheart_Recruitment_Gob)

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: It's reciprocal, trust me. We need each other... Once we're cured, well, our partnership can end, if that's what you wish.

214.speaker: Shadowheart
214.text: But make no mistake - when the time comes, the artefact leaves with me.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Are you willing to tell me how you came by it now?
126.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH had previously refused to answer this question due to low approval

340.speaker: Shadowheart
340.text: You could say that... and yes, I still have it.

300.speaker: Shadowheart
300.text: I'm not sure what else I can say, at least until I can remember more... she taught me, trained me, punished me...

230.speaker: Shadowheart
230.text: I'm not sure what else I can say, at least until I can remember more... she taught me, trained me, punished me...

265.speaker: Shadowheart
265.text: Often I think I feel her influence, when the wound pains me. Not even memories, just... glimpses, impressions. Perhaps the wound is her doing; something Lady Shar bid her to do. I don't know.

323.speaker: Shadowheart
323.text: There's something I want to talk to you about. Something important.

343.speaker: Shadowheart
343.text: Must there be? I've learned to live with it. It's fine, I swear.
